bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document

org.orgName: Western District Court of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of Application of Chin Quock Wah, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus ) No. 2971 ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE.

The above named Petitioner having made application to this Court for Writ of Habeas Corpus, by and through Adam Beeler, of the Law Firm of Beeler & Sullivan, attorneys and counsellors for the said Petitioner, address to the United States Commissioner of Immigration, Henry M. White and to such other person or persons, agent or agents, acting by, through or under him, or in behalf of the United States Government, in whose custody the Petitioner is shown by his petition to be confined and restrained of his liberty and to be ordered deported, as alleged in his petition illegally and unwarranted and without power and not under virtue of or by authority of the Statutes of the United States, and the Court being fully advised by Beeler & Sullivan, counsel for the said Petitioner.

IT IS NOW THEREFORE ORDERED, that the United States Commissioner of Immigration, Henry M. White, in and for the District of Washington in charge of the Immigration Station and Detention House at Seattle, S tate of Washington, and such person or persons acting under or through the said Henry M. White, said Commissioner of Immigration and in behalf of the United States Government, having the custody of the said Petitioner Chin Quock Wah show cause before this Court at the Courtroom at the Federal Building in the City of Seattle on the 15 day of March, 1915, at 10 - o'clock in the AM. why said application should not be granted, and in the meantime, the United States Commissioner of Immigration -1-
Henry M. White in and for the District of Washington in charge of the Immigration and Detention Station at Seattle, Washington, as well as such other person or persons who are acting under and through you, refrain and desist from deporting or placing, and removing said Petitioner Ching Quock Wah, from the said District of Washington, or carrying into effect any warrant or order for his deportation which may be held by you or either of you.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that said Chin Quock Wah either by himself or through his attorney Adam Beeler, of the Law Firm of Beeler & Sullivan, within five days give over to the United States Commissioner of Immigration, Henry M. White, in charge of the Immigration Station at Seattle, Washington, such amount as he may demand as a fund for the keeping of said Chin Quock Wah until said action of this Court in hearing said petition or until such further action of the Government in relation to his case is considered, which sum shall not exceed the sum of $100.00.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that a certified copy of this order shall be served upon the Honorable United States Commissioner of Immigration, Henry M. White, or such person or persons acting by or through him or in behalf of the United S tates in connection with the Immigration Station at Seattle, Washington, or any such Government official in charge of said Chin Quock Wah, Petitioner, on or before the hour of 10 o'clock aM, of this 4 day of March, 1915, 1915.
United States of America, Western, District of Washington, } ss:

I hereby certify and return that I served the annexed Habeas Corpus, on the therein-named Henry M White, United States Commissioner of Immigration,
by handing to and leaving a true and correct copy thereof with John H. Sargent, personally at Seattle Washington, in said District on the 4th, day of March, , A.D. 1915.
div1.ab: John M Boyle. U.S. Marshal By Morton D. Wainwright Deputy
div1.p: IN THE SUPERIOR UNITED STATED DISTRICT COURT STATE OF WASHINGTON WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON KING COUNTY NORTHERN DIVISION
UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT OF AMERICA. Plaintiff vs. CHIN QUOCK WAH Defendant
BEELER & SULLIVAN Attorneys for Defendant. 510-11 WHITE BUILDING SEATTLE, WASH.
2X FILED IN THE U. S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION MAR5-1915
div1.ab: FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By EML Deputy
